addrs.description: one or more addresses (0x...) to export

topics.description: filter by one or more log topics (only for --logs option)

fourbytes.description: filter by one or more fourbytes (only for transactions and trace options)

receipts.description: export receipts instead of transaction list

logs.description: export logs instead of transaction list

traces.description: export traces instead of transaction list

accounting.description: export accounting records instead of transaction list

tokens.description: export accounting for ERC 20 tokens (assumes ETH accounting as above)

articulate.description: articulate transactions, traces, logs, and outputs

cache_txs.description: write transactions to the cache (see notes)

cache_traces.description: write traces to the cache (see notes)

skip_ddos.description: toggle skipping over 2016 dDos transactions ('on' by default)

max_traces.description: if --skip_ddos is on, this many traces defines what a ddos transaction is (default = 250)

freshen.description: freshen but do not print the exported data

factory.description: scan for contract creations from the given address(es) and report address of those contracts

emitter.description: for log export only, export only if one of the given export addresses emitted the event

source.description: for log export only, export only one of these addresses emitted the event

relevant.description: for log export only, if true export only logs relevant to one of the given export addresses

count.description: only available for --appearances mode, if present return only the number of records

max_records.description: the maximum number of records to process before reporting

clean.description: clean (i.e. remove duplicate appearances) from all existing monitors

staging.description: enable search of staging (not yet finalized) folder

unripe.description: enable search of unripe (neither staged nor finalized) folder (assumes --staging)

export.description: Export full detail of transactions for one or more Ethereum addresses.

mode.description: control the block and account scrapers

tool.description: process the index, monitors, or both (none means process timestamps only)

n_blocks.description: maximum number of blocks to process (defaults to 5000)

n_block_procs.description: number of block channels for blaze

n_addr_procs.description: number of address channels for blaze

pin.description: pin new chunks (and blooms) to IPFS (requires Pinata key and running IPFS node)

sleep.description: the number of seconds to sleep between passes (default 14)

cache_txs.description: write transactions to the cache (see notes)

cache_traces.description: write traces to the cache (see notes)

scrape.description: Decentralized blockchain scraper and block cache.

modes.description: the type of status info to retrieve

details.description: include details about items found in monitors, slurps, abis, or price caches

types.description: for caches mode only, which type(s) of cache to report

depth.description: for cache mode only, number of levels deep to report

report.description: show a summary of the current status of TrueBlocks (deprecated)

get_config.description: returns JSON data of the editable configuration file items

set_config.description: accepts JSON in an env variable and writes it to configuration files

status.description: Report on status of one or more TrueBlocks caches.

compare.description: report differences (if any) between the manifest and pinning service

init.description: initialize the local index by downloading bloom filters from the pinning service

freshen.description: freshen the manifest from the hash found at the smart contract

sleep.description: the number of seconds to sleep between requests during init (default .25)

pins.description: Report on and manage the remotely pinned appearance index and associated bloom filters.

pair.description: which price pair to freshen or list (see Poloniex)

feed.description: the feed for the price data

quotes.description: Freshen and/or display Ethereum price data.

addrs.description: one or more addresses to slurp from Etherscan

blocks.description: an optional range of blocks to slurp

types.description: one or more types of transactions to request

appearances.description: show only the blocknumer.tx_id appearances of the exported transactions

slurp.description: Fetches data from EtherScan for an arbitrary address.

terms.description: a space separated list of one or more search terms

expand.description: expand search to include all fields (default searches name, address, and symbol only)

all.description: include all accounts in the search

named.description: include well know token and airdrop addresses in the search

addr.description: display only addresses in the results (useful for scripting)

tags.description: export the list of tags and subtags only

to_custom.description: for editCmd only, is the edited name a custom name or not

clean.description: clean the data (addrs to lower case, sort by addr)

names.description: Query addresses and/or names of well known accounts.

blocks.description: a space-separated list of one or more blocks to retrieve

hashes.description: display only transaction hashes, default is to display full transaction detail

uncles.description: display uncle blocks (if any) instead of the requested block

trace.description: export the traces from the block as opposed to the block data

apps.description: display all address appearances in the block

uniq.description: display only uniq address appearances per block

uniq_tx.description: display only uniq address appearances per transaction

count.description: display counts of appearances (for --apps, --uniq, or --uniq_tx) or transactions

cache.description: force a write of the block to the cache

blocks.description: Returns block(s) from local cache or directly from a running node.

transactions.description: a space-separated list of one or more transaction identifiers

articulate.description: articulate the retrieved data if ABIs can be found

trace.description: include the transaction's traces in the results

uniq.description: display a list of uniq addresses found in the transaction instead of the underlying data

cache.description: force the results of the query into the tx cache (and the trace cache if applicable)

transactions.description: Retrieves one or more transactions from the cache or the node.
a space-separated list of one or more transaction identifiers

articulate.description: articulate the retrieved data if ABIs can be found

receipts.description: Retrieve a transaction's receipt from the cache or the node.

transactions.description: a space-separated list of one or more transaction identifiers

topic.description: filter by one or more log topics (not implemented)

source.description: export only if the given address emitted the event (not implemented)

articulate.description: articulate the retrieved data if ABIs can be found

logs.description: Retrieve a transaction's logs from the cache or the node.

transactions.description: a space-separated list of one or more transaction identifiers

articulate.description: articulate the retrieved data if ABIs can be found

filter.description: call the node's `trace_filter` routine with bang-seperated filter

count.description: show the number of traces for the transaction only (fast)

skip_ddos.description: skip over the 2016 ddos during export ('on' by default)

max.description: if --skip_ddos is on, this many traces defines what a ddos transaction is (default = 250)

traces.description: Retrieve a transaction's traces from the cache or the node.

addrs.description: one or more addresses (0x...) from which to retrieve balances

blocks.description: an optional list of one or more blocks at which to report balances, defaults to 'latest'

changes.description: only report a balance when it changes from one block to the next

no_zero.description: suppress the display of zero balance accounts

call.description: a bang-separated string consisting of address!4-byte!bytes

state.description: Retrieve the balance of one or more address at the given block(s).

addrs2.description: two or more addresses (0x...), the first is an ERC20 token, balances for the rest are reported

blocks.description: an optional list of one or more blocks at which to report balances, defaults to 'latest'

parts.description: one or more parts of the token information to retreive

by_acct.description: consider each address an ERC20 token except the last, whose balance is reported for each token

no_zero.description: suppress the display of zero balance accounts

tokens.description: Retrieve token balances for one or more address at given block(s).

addrs.description: list of one or more smart contracts whose ABI to grab from EtherScan

sol.description: file name of .sol file from which to create a new known abi (without .sol)

find.description: try to search for a function declaration given a four byte code

abis.description: Fetches the ABI for a smart contract.

block_list.description: one or more dates, block numbers, hashes, or special named blocks (see notes)

list.description: export a list of the 'special' blocks

timestamps.description: ignore other options and generate timestamps only

skip.description: only applicable if --timestamps is on, the step between block numbers in the export

when.description: Finds block based on date, blockNum, timestamp, or 'special'.
